Comments.Message: There was a change to relevant stats that removed it is what it is referring to, is the only defect that 4T9 isn't implemented?

I'm not sure, I was commenting the changelog from alpineman to warn him about mana pot handling.
4pc T9 isn't modelled now, yes. It should be fairly easy, though might need specific crit overhealing handling (I checked your last commit, looks like you're adding support for crit overhealing).

Crit over-healing handling is actually pretty straightforward, if 40% of your healing is over healing, short of pulling each spell out seperately (which is on the table still) you can safely assume that if 40% of a normal healing spell will be overheal, then 60% of a crit will be over-heal.
Mana potion (More specifically bonus mana potion) and the 4t9 were pointed at as 'Not Implemented' because they were commented out to make things cleaner, since they aren't used.
A bit offtopic, but still valid -- to properly support crit overhealing, RTOverheal should be split into RTHitOverheal and RTTickOverheal for obvious reasons.
Also, RT+LHW healing now calculates LHW healing part without respect to crit overhealing penalty (i.e. it uses CriticalScale without CritPenalty).

LHW Calcs fixed, mana pot is pretty much a non-issue since it's handled by Mana Restore (working to remove all the bonusmanapotion code), and 4T9 is added.
And while 4t9 is added, well, it pretty much doesn't really do much.  CH overheal eats crit alive.

EJ people almost universally agree that 4pc T9 is bad (Valkyrie Twins or Festergut gas phases are probably the only fights where it might be useful, but even there less desired stats -- crit+mp5 on head and legs just don't cut it).
Shouldn't (CritPenalty) be (1 - CritPenalty)? Currently, zero overhealing model leads to zero critical effect, but it should be the other way around.
Also, there might be a need for a separate overhealing scale for 4pc T10 hot (I think it would mostly be a waste on most fights, along the lines of ELW, but with even more overhealing).
